Description of incident: ABC15 Arizona reports:Officials with Terros Health say a data breach has possibly compromised personal information of more than one thousand of its patients.In a news release Friday, June 8, the company says it mailed letters to 1,600 people whose information may have been accessed by an unauthorized third party.Patients' name, date of birth, physical and email address, diagnosis, medical records number and "other protected health information" may have been exposed.Nearly all of those potentially impacted by the breach received treatment at the clinic near 23rd and Dunlap avenues in Phoenix. Additionally, the company said 1,241 of the 1,600 patients may have only had their name and birthday disclosed.
